Package edu.swarthmore.cs.spoon.interfaces

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Action
    An Action refers to player action that costs spoons, affecting the Spoon Allowance Point System within the game.
    CampaignGoal
    campaign goals are for any player to finish over the course of the game.
    EnvironmentalObject
    Any Thing that is an inanimate part of the environment and cannot be picked up by a player
    Goal
    A task that needs to be completed by a specified deadline
    House
    A particular player's house.
    Inventory
    Keeps track of all the items that a player is currently carrying
    Item
    Any Thing that it is possible for a player to pick up and add to their inventory
    Location
    This indicates the varying locations of the game.
    MazeGame
    Handles the logic of the maze minigame: gennerates the maze, and keeps track of items found.
    PersonalGoal
    personal goals are to be completed by specified players and people they have asked for help from
    Pet
    A friendly animal that a player can adopt and raise in their house
    Phone
    An engine for sending and receiving requests for help between a particular player and all other players
    Plant
    A friendly plant that a player can adopt and raise in their house
    PlayerCharacter
    represents one player for one full game session
    Position
    contains the X and Y coordinates for a Thing
    Thing
    Any entity in our game that can be represented as having physical existence and is not a location This includes items the players can acquire, objects in the environment, pets, plants, and the player characters themselves
    UnexpectedActivity
    An event that might occur when the player tries to perform an Action that costs spoons.
    World
    handles things that affect all players uniformly; sets up the game and transitions from day to night
